ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot about Martial and Juvenal as authors and Satire as a genre. I learned to develop broader considerations about genre and to think about connections with the previous literary tradition and the importance of those connection. I honed my close-reading abilities and I engaged in an always meaningful debate.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: * focus on close-reading * focus on genre and related issues * attention to the historical context, both in its cultural and socio-political dimensions Weaknesses: * incoherence between each others weekly presentations. I would have rather work as a group around the same idea or set of texts and have everyone presents one part.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this course to someone interested in exploring Martial and Juvenal, in understanding satire as a literary genre, in thinking about the socio.political context through text (with all the problems that this entails). I would also recommend this course to someone interested in improving his/hers close-reading skills, as professor Freudenburg offered not only an excellent example of 'how to do close-reading', but was also extremely detailed in giving feedback on how to improve.
It was an excellent course with interesting readings, thoughtful discussion, and a helpful instructor. I think that succinctly summarizes a class one should want to take.
